definition: half the sky/women of the new society/womenfolk
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
side/edge/margin/border/boundary/CL:個|个[ge4]/simultaneously
suffix of a noun of locality
day/sky/heaven
Woman can hold up half the sky/fig. nowadays, women have an equal part to play in society
pinyin: fu4 nu:3 neng2 ding3 ban4 bian1 tian1

sentences.english: Shigeo Tokuda is a very famous celebrity in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 德田重男是一位紅透半邊天的日本名人。

sentences.english: Women can hold up half the sky.
Half the sky burns red, pressing heavily down upon the bald head of the sun.
sentences.chinese: 半邊天燒紅了，重甸甸地壓在夕陽的光頭上。

sentences.english: And women in China have taken an important place in the fight to preserve the environment in their own country.
sentences.chinese: 今天，中國婦女已經頂起了中國環境保護的半邊天。

sentences.english: Today women make up about half of the total number of competitors.
sentences.chinese: 如今，女選手大約佔據了參賽選手總人數的半邊天。

to tease/to poke fun at
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
known to everyone
entertainment world/show business
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to blush/to turn red
to envy/to admire

to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to tinkle/to jingle/to clank
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
